summary: The Louvre Museum in Paris is set to undergo extensive renovations, focusing on managing overcrowding and preserving artworks. French President Emmanuel Macron announced that the Mona Lisa will be moved to a dedicated gallery as part of the renovation, aiming to alleviate the overcrowding from over 8 million annual visitors. A new entrance will also be constructed to streamline visitor flow. The project, estimated to cost between €700 to €800 million, will be largely self-financed through increased ticket fees for non-EU citizens, donations, and partnerships like the Louvre Abu Dhabi. This move highlights a larger strategy to maintain and enhance cultural heritage while managing modern challenges within the famed museum.
title: Mona Lisa to get a room of her own in Louvre museum renovation

summary: Tanner Fox was sentenced to life in prison without parole for 20 years by the British Columbia Supreme Court for the murder of Sikh businessman Ripudaman Singh Malik, who was shot dead outside his business in Surrey in July 2022. Fox and accomplice Jose Lopez had pleaded guilty to second-degree murder, admitting they were paid to kill Malik. The killing occurred years after Malik was acquitted of charges related to the 1985 Air India bombings. Malik’s family continues to seek answers on who hired Fox and Lopez for the murder, expressing fear for their safety. The murder reflects ongoing aftermath issues from the historic Air India tragedy.
title: Hitman sentenced to life in prison for B.C. murder of former Air India bombing suspect
